makers.displaydate: 1484–1551; born Cortine in Valdibiana Montaperti, Italy; died Siena, Italy
makers.displaymaker: Domenico Beccafumi, 1484–1551; born Cortine in Valdibiana Montaperti, Italy; died Siena, Italy

texts.textentryhtml: This devotional work by the Sienese painter Beccafumi is unfinished and may have been one of his last works. The underdrawing on the panel is visible through thinly applied layers of paint. Bright colors and flickering surfaces exemplify the interest sixteenth-century viewers took in works they had to complete in their minds, collaborating with the artist. It was in this period that Michelangelo’s unfinished sculptures began to be considered icons of genius.

Cosimo I de'Medici, Florence (ca. 1561/74); Ralph Palmer, Esq., England (until 1755; sale, Prestage, London, April 11, 1775, lot 29, to Hawks); Frank Sabin, London (in 1952); anonymous sale, Christie’s London, July 16, 1954, lot 93, to Smith; Calmann, London; Frank Sabin, London (in 1955; to Weitzner); Julius Weitzner, London and New York (1955–58; sold to the Princeton University Art Museum).
